articles.content:
Sam Cane has been named captain of the All Blacks in a surprise announcement from new coach Ian Foster. Chiefs flanker Cane, 28, will replace Kieran Read, who retired from Tests after New Zealand placed third at last years World Cup.
It is the first signific… [+1992 chars]

articles.author: Matt Encarnacion
articles.title: 'We have to be hard': Nine willing to walk away from NRL if price is not right - Wide World of Sports
articles.description: Future broadcast deal in fresh doubt
articles.content:
Nine Entertainment chief executive Hugh Marks has fired another salvo at the NRL, saying it's not a given the league is a part of the network's future.
Marks' comments come as delicate discussions continue with the NRL over how much it will pay to broadcast … [+2642 chars]

articles.author: Sam Phillips
articles.title: 'They nearly lost him': Reynolds compares Latrell 'harassment' to MJ - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: South Sydney skipper Adam Reynolds has compared the treatment of Latrell Mitchell to Michael Jordan in a strident defence of the Rabbitohs superstar.
articles.content:
The Bulls were led by the biggest of stars in Michael Jordan and Reynolds can see similarities between Mitchell and the player many consider the greatest athlete of all time.
"I think we need to give him a rest. The media keep bashing him up," Reynolds said.… [+1901 chars]

articles.title: Ash Barty and Pat Rafter thank ace nurses for their service high on a hospital helipad - ABC News
articles.description: A grand slam of a different kind has seen two Brisbane nurses take on the world's best tennis players high in the sky on a hospital rooftop.
articles.content:
A grand slam of a different kind has brought two Brisbane nurses together with two of the biggest names in world tennis high on a hospital rooftop.
World number one Ash Barty and former number one Pat Rafter took to a court on the helipad of the Royal Brisba… [+2199 chars]

articles.title: Fox in the hole: NRL could go back to the future in TV merry-go-round - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Rupert Murdoch could again be in control of rugby league as the brouhaha over the NRL's TV rights continues to play out in the public square.
articles.content:
Nine boss Hugh Marks told a meeting of analysts and investors on Tuesday afternoon that it is not a given that NRL has to be part of our future.
